title: 34k-Mile 1988 Porsche 911 Turbo Coupe M505 Slant Nose
description: This 1988 Porsche 911 Turbo left the factory with M505 slant-nose bodywork, and it shows 34k miles after spending the last 25 years in Georgia and Florida. It is powered by a turbocharged 3.3-liter flat-six linked with a four-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential, and it is finished in Guards Red over black partial leather upholstery. The car is equipped with red 16" Fuchs alloy wheels, four-wheel cross-drilled and ventilated disc brakes, a sunroof, a Blaupunkt Reno SQR 46 cassette radio, fully power-adjustable front seats, and R134a-based air conditioning. This M505 930 Turbo coupe is now offered by the selling dealer with a Porsche Certificate of Authenticity, service records, tools, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 34k-Mile 1988 Porsche 911 Turbo Coupe M505 Slant Nose at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #195,391.
text: This 1988 Porsche 911 Turbo left the factory with M505 slant-nose bodywork, and it shows 34k miles after spending the last 25 years in Georgia and Florida. It is powered by a turbocharged 3.3-liter flat-six linked with a four-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential, and it is finished in Guards Red over black partial leather upholstery. The car is equipped with red 16″ Fuchs alloy wheels, four-wheel cross-drilled and ventilated disc brakes, a sunroof, a Blaupunkt Reno SQR 46 cassette radio, fully power-adjustable front seats, and R134a-based air conditioning. This M505 930 Turbo coupe is now offered by the selling dealer with a Porsche Certificate of Authenticity, service records, tools, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title. The car is finished in Guards Red and is equipped with factory flachbau bodywork (M505), a package that featured pop-up headlights, vented front fenders, side strakes, and extended side sills. The car is also equipped with a sunroof and a tea-tray rear spoiler. Red-finished 16″ Fuchs alloy wheels are mounted with Bridgestone Potenza RE-11 tires, and the lug nuts were replaced in preparation for the sale. Braking is handled by four-wheel cross-drilled and ventilated discs, and Turbo models received front and rear sway bars as standard. The cabin is trimmed in black partial leather, and it features fully power-adjustable front seats, a Blaupunkt Reno SQR 46 radio, and R134a-based air conditioning. The air-conditioning drier was repalced in May 2023. The steering wheel features a full-color Porsche crest. VDO instrumentation including a central tachometer with a 6,700-rpm redline as well as a 170-mph speedometer and gauges for oil pressure, oil temperature, oil level, fuel level, and boost pressure. The six-digit odometer shows 34k miles. The turbocharged 3.3-liter flat-six was factory rated at 282 horsepower and 278 lb-ft of torque. Work in preparation for the sale has included an oil change and replacing the CDI box, ignition coil, blow-off valve gaskets, and engine insulation. The engine-lid struts were replaced in April 2022. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a four-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential. Additional photographs of the underside are shown in the gallery below. The Porsche Certificate of Authenticity lists factory colors and options along with a production completion date of December 3, 1987. The Carfax report shows no accidents or damage. html:
This 1988 Porsche 911 Turbo left the factory with M505 slant-nose bodywork, and it shows 34k miles after spending the last 25 years in Georgia and Florida. It is powered by a turbocharged 3.3-liter flat-six linked with a four-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential, and it is finished in Guards Red over black partial leather upholstery. The car is equipped with red 16″ Fuchs alloy wheels, four-wheel cross-drilled and ventilated disc brakes, a sunroof, a Blaupunkt Reno SQR 46 cassette radio, fully power-adjustable front seats, and R134a-based air conditioning. This M505 930 Turbo coupe is now offered by the selling dealer with a Porsche Certificate of Authenticity, service records, tools, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Florida title.

The car is finished in Guards Red and is equipped with factory flachbau bodywork (M505), a package that featured pop-up headlights, vented front fenders, side strakes, and extended side sills. The car is also equipped with a sunroof and a tea-tray rear spoiler.

Red-finished 16″ Fuchs alloy wheels are mounted with Bridgestone Potenza RE-11 tires, and the lug nuts were replaced in preparation for the sale. Braking is handled by four-wheel cross-drilled and ventilated discs, and Turbo models received front and rear sway bars as standard.

The cabin is trimmed in black partial leather, and it features fully power-adjustable front seats, a Blaupunkt Reno SQR 46 radio, and R134a-based air conditioning. The air-conditioning drier was repalced in May 2023. The steering wheel features a full-color Porsche crest.

VDO instrumentation including a central tachometer with a 6,700-rpm redline as well as a 170-mph speedometer and gauges for oil pressure, oil temperature, oil level, fuel level, and boost pressure. The six-digit odometer shows 34k miles.

The turbocharged 3.3-liter flat-six was factory rated at 282 horsepower and 278 lb-ft of torque. Work in preparation for the sale has included an oil change and replacing the CDI box, ignition coil, blow-off valve gaskets, and engine insulation. The engine-lid struts were replaced in April 2022.

Power is sent to the rear wheels via a four-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential. Additional photographs of the underside are shown in the gallery below.

The Porsche Certificate of Authenticity lists factory colors and options along with a production completion date of December 3, 1987.

The Carfax report shows no accidents or damage.
